DataElement.preferredName: Body Fluid or Substance Specimen Requirement Type Fluid Specimen Text Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Liquid and semi liquid substances produced by living organisms to fulfill specific functions or excreted as waste; does not include hormones or enzymes.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing._A continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container (i.e., a liquid or a gas).  Also used as an adjective to describe something with properties like that of a fluid.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Text; the words of something written._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Body Fluid or Substance Specimen Requirement Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Liquid and semi liquid substances produced by living organisms to fulfill specific functions or excreted as waste; does not include hormones or enzymes.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Body Fluid or Substance Specimen Requirement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Liquid and semi liquid substances produced by living organisms to fulfill specific functions or excreted as waste; does not include hormones or enzymes.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory.

Concepts.definition: Material produced by living organisms; it can be a necessary constituent of, or product of an organismal process.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Requirement; something that is necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/28/10 Released for use in caTissue Suite version 1.1 and/or 1.2 per owners direction.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container (i.e., a liquid or a gas).  Also used as an adjective to describe something with properties like that of a fluid.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Text; the words of something written._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid within the amniotic cavity which surrounds and protects the developing embryo.  It is initially produced by the amnion and then later by the lungs and kidneys.  The amount at term normally varies from 500 to 2000 ml.

Concepts.definition: The fluid within the amniotic cavity which surrounds and protects the developing embryo. It is initially produced by the amnion and then later by the lungs and kidneys. The amount at term normally varies from 500 to 2000 ml.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The liquid secreted by the sweat glands, having a salty taste and a pH that varies from 4.5 to 7.5. Sweat produced by the eccrine sweat glands is clear with a faint characteristic odor, and contains water, sodium chloride, and traces of albumin, urea, and other compounds. Its composition varies with many factors, e.g., fluid intake, external temperature and humidity, and some hormonal activity. Sweat produced by the larger, deeper, apocrine sweat glands of the axillae contains, in addition, organic material which on bacterial decomposition produces an offensive odor.

Concepts.definition: The liquid secreted by the sweat glands, having a salty taste and a pH that varies from 4.5 to 7.5. Sweat produced by the eccrine sweat glands is clear with a faint characteristic odor, and contains water, sodium chloride, and traces of albumin, urea, and other compounds. Its composition varies with many factors, e.g., fluid intake, external temperature and humidity, and some hormonal activity. Sweat produced by the larger, deeper, apocrine sweat glands of the axillae contains, in addition, organic material which on bacterial decomposition produces an offensive odor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Milk produced by female humans for the purpose of feeding their young.

Concepts.definition: Milk produced by female mammals for the purpose of feeding their young.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the stomach.: Fluid; a continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container: a liquid or a gas.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the stomach.

A continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container (i.e., a liquid or a gas).  Also used as an adjective to describe something with properties like that of a fluid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An emulsifying agent produced in the LIVER and secreted into the DUODENUM. Its composition includes BILE ACIDS AND SALTS, CHOLESTEROL, and ELECTROLYTES. It aids DIGESTION of fats in the duodenum.

Concepts.definition: Fluid composed of waste products, bile acids, salts, cholesterol, and electrolytes. It is secreted by the liver parenchyma and stored in the gallbladder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.

Concepts.definition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Blood that has not been separated into its various components; blood that has not been modified except for the addition of an anticoagulant.

Concepts.definition: Blood that has not been separated into its various components; blood that has not been modified except for the addition of an anticoagulant.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Whole; including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.

Concepts.definition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fluid containing water and waste products. Urine is made by the kidneys, stored in the bladder, and leaves the body through the urethra.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clear liquid secreted into the mouth by the salivary glands and mucous glands of the mouth; moistens the mouth and starts the digestion of starches.

Concepts.definition: The watery fluid in the mouth made by the salivary glands. Saliva moistens food to help digestion and it helps protect the mouth against infections.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Material coughed up from the lungs and expectorated via the mouth. It contains MUCUS, cellular debris, and microorganisms. It may also contain blood or pus.

Concepts.definition: Material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus.  It is ejected through the mouth from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Washing out a hollow organ (especially the stomach) by flushing with a fluid.

Concepts.definition: Washing out a hollow organ (especially the stomach) by flushing with a fluid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Located around the heart or relating to or affecting the pericardium.: Fluid; a continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container: a liquid or a gas.

Concepts.definition: Located around the heart or relating to or affecting the pericardium.

A continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container (i.e., a liquid or a gas).  Also used as an adjective to describe something with properties like that of a fluid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A viscid fluid secreted by the synovial membrane, serving as a lubricant.

Concepts.definition: A viscid fluid secreted by the synovial membrane, serving as a lubricant.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural hollow or sinus within the body.: Fluid; a continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container: a liquid or a gas.

Concepts.definition: A natural hollow or sinus within the body.

A continuous amorphous substance that tends to flow and to conform to the outline of its container (i.e., a liquid or a gas).  Also used as an adjective to describe something with properties like that of a fluid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clear, avascular, gelatinous body that occupies the posterior chamber of the eye. It is bounded by the retina except anteriorly where it lies adjacent to the lens and iris.

Concepts.definition: The clear colorless transparent jelly that fills the posterior chamber of the eyeball.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The words of something written.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
